usefulItems: tea towel, non-stick pan (Ø 22 cm), ladle, hob
title: Crêpes

ingredients.content: 50 g butter, unsalted, plus extra for frying

preparations.content: Place butter in mixing bowl and melt <b>2 min/70°C/speed 2<b>.

Add milk, water, flour, eggs and salt to mixing bowl and mix <b>20 sec/speed 4<b>. The batter should have the consistency of liquid cream. If it seems too thick, add a little milk. Allow batter to rest for at least 30 minutes before using.

Lightly grease a non-stick frying pan with butter and heat on medium-high. Pour in a small ladle of batter, twirling the pan as you pour to cover base of pan completely. Cook for 2-3 minutes or until edges of crêpe are light golden. Turn crêpe over and cook for a further 1 minute. Transfer to a plate and cover with a tea towel to keep warm. Repeat with remaining batter. Serve warm.

hintsAndTricks: To replace butter with oil, omit <b>step 1<b> and add <b>50 g oil<b> along with all other ingredients in <b>step 2.<b> Use oil instead of butter for frying.
Flavour the crêpes in <b>step 2:<b> add <b>40 g vanilla<b> sugar, <b>1 tsp grated<b> orange zest, or <b>80 g sugar<b> and <b>2 tbsp rum.<b>
Crêpes can be served with sweet or savoury fillings.

Crêpes can be frozen for later use. Place a piece of baking paper or cling film between each crêpe before freezing so they can be easily defrosted. After defrosting, wrap crêpes in aluminium foil and warm in a preheated oven (150°C) for <b>5-10 minutes.<b>
